projectDescription: This website is running on a Raspberry Pi Model 3b. It is currently set up using a reverse-proxy nginx server, which is used to manage the SSL. Behind this proxy server is a couple node.js applications that serve all the website content. The content is served and templated using express and handlebars, respectively. As the raspberry pi is sitting on my home network, a dynamic DNS needed to be setup. To achive this, I used the DDNS built into Google Domains, as that is where my domain was purchased. A script runs on the raspberry pi every hour to check if the IP address has changed and, if it did, it will update the Google DDNS server.

projectImageAlt: Image of the Tic Tac Toe Webpage.
projectDescription: This project, initally created as the final project for CS290 - Web Development, uses Websockets to make a dynamic, multiplayer game of TikTakToe. In this game, the turns cycle in a queue-based system, in order of opening the webpage. The game continues until Tik wins, Tak wins, or there is a tie. The game allows dynamic joining and exiting of players, constant syncing of clients, and a synced place-in-queue counter.

This project is currently a WIP to learn React. I am seeking to make a nicer portfolio page that is styled like a terminal. Preferably, it will support interactivity, nice animations, and all the features of this webpage.
